H0.text: Direction is the property that a vector has in addition to magnitude.

H1.text: Length is the property a vector has in addition to magnitude.

H2.text: Longitude is the other attribute that a vector, any quantity that has magnitude, possesses.

H3.text: Latitude is the property that, along with magnitude, defines a vector as any quantity that has magnitude and latitude.

A4.text: such quantities have both a magnitude and a direction, such as displacements, forces and velocity.
